TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit GridViewRow extends System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableRow implements class System.Web.UI.IDataItemContainer, class System.Web.UI.INamingContainer
Public Class GridViewRow Inherits TableRow Implements IDataItemContainer
public ref class GridViewRow : System::Web::UI::WebControls::TableRow, System::Web::UI::IDataItemContainer
type GridViewRow = class inherit TableRow interface IDataItemContainer interface INamingContainer

Docs.summary: Represents an individual row in a control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow> class is used represent an individual row in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control. Each row in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control has a designated row type using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlRowType> enumeration. The following table lists the different row types.
|Row type|Description| |--------------|-----------------| |`DataRow`|A data row in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control.| |`EmptyDataRow`|The empty row in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control. The empty row is displayed when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control has no records to display and the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView.EmptyDataTemplate%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> template is not `null`.| |`Footer`|The footer row in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control.| |`Header`|The header row in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control.| |`Pager`|A pager row in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control.| |`Separator`|A separator row in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control.|
To determine the row type of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow> object, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow.RowType%2A> property. A <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow> object also has a state associated with it. The state can be a bitwise combination of the values in the following table.
|State value|Description| |-----------------|-----------------| |`Alternate`|The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow> object is an alternate row in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control.| |`Edit`|The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow> object is in edit mode.| |`Normal`|The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow> object is in its normal (default) state.| |`Selected`|The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow> object is selected.|
To determine the state of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow> object, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow.RowState%2A> property.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control stores all of its data rows in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView.Rows%2A> collection. To determine the index of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow> object in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView.Rows%2A> collection, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow.RowIndex%2A> property.
You can access the properties of the underlying data object that is bound to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow> object by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow.DataItem%2A> property.
> [!NOTE] > The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow.DataItem%2A> property is available only during and after the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView.RowDataBound> event of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control.
To determine the index of the data object in the underlying data source, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow.DataItemIndex%2A> property.
You can access the individual cells of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow> object by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableRow.Cells%2A> property. If a cell contains other controls, you can retrieve a control from the cell by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.Controls%2A> collection of the cell. You can also use the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.FindControl%2A> method of the cell to find the control, if the control has an <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.ID%2A> specified.
To retrieve a field value from a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BoundField> field column or an automatically generated field column, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCell.Text%2A> property of the cell. To retrieve a field value from other field column types where the field value is bound to a control, first retrieve the control from the appropriate cell and then access the appropriate property of the control.
> [!NOTE] > It is possible to use a data-binding expression directly in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TemplateField> field column without binding the value to a property of a control. In this case, the field value is automatically placed in a <xref:System.Web.UI.DataBoundLiteralControl> control. To retrieve the field value, you must first retrieve the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataBoundLiteralControl> control from the appropriate cell and then use its <xref:System.Web.UI.DataBoundLiteralControl.Text%2A> property.
For a list of initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow>, see the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow.%23ctor%2A> constructor.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to use a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow> object to retrieve a field value from a cell in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control and then display the value on the page.
[!code-aspx-csharp[GridViewRow#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/GridViewRow/CS/gridviewrowcs.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[GridViewRow#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/GridViewRow/VB/gridviewrowvb.aspx#1)]
The following example demonstrates how to use a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow> object to retrieve a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TextBox> control declared in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TemplateField> field column's edit item template. The value of the text box is then passed to a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource> control for updating in the data source.
> [!IMPORTANT] > This example has a text box that accepts user input, which is a potential security threat. By default, ASP.NET Web pages validate that user input does not include script or HTML elements. For more information, see [Script Exploits Overview](https://docs.microsoft.com/previous-versions/aspnet/w1sw53ds(v=vs.100)).
[!code-aspx-csharp[GridViewRowFindControl#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/GridViewRowFindControl/CS/gridviewrowfindcontrolcs.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[GridViewRowFindControl#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/GridViewRowFindControl/VB/gridviewrowfindcontrolvb.aspx#1)]

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this constructor to initialize a new instance of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow> object.
The following table shows initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow>.
|Property|Initial Value| |--------------|-------------------| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow.DataItemIndex%2A>|The value of the `dataItemIndex` parameter.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow.RowIndex%2A>|The value of the `rowIndex` parameter.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow.RowState%2A>|The value of the `rowState` parameter.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow.RowType%2A>|The value of the `rowType` parameter.|

Docs.summary: Gets the underlying data object to which the object is bound.
Docs.value: An that represents the underlying data object to which the object is bound.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow.DataItem%2A> property to access the properties of the underlying data object to which the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow> object is bound. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow.DataItem%2A> property is only available during and after the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView.RowDataBound> event of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control.
> [!NOTE] > This property applies only to data rows.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow.DataItem%2A> property to retrieve a field value. The value is then used to pre-select an item in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DropDownList> control displayed when a row is in edit mode.
[!code-aspx-csharp[GridViewRowDataItem#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/GridViewRowDataItem/CS/gridviewrowdataitemcs.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[GridViewRowDataItem#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/GridViewRowDataItem/VB/gridviewrowdataitemvb.aspx#1)]

## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow.DataItemIndex%2A> property to determine the index of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow.DataItem%2A> in the underlying <xref:System.Data.DataSet>.
> [!NOTE] > This property applies only to data rows.

Docs.summary: Gets the state of the object.
Docs.value: A bitwise combination of the values.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow.RowType%2A> property to determine the state of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow> object. The state can be a bitwise combination of the values in the following table:
|Status value|Description| |------------------|-----------------| |`DataControlRowState.Alternate`|The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow> object is an alternate row in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control.| |`DataControlRowState.Edit`|The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow> object is in edit mode.| |`DataControlRowState.Normal`|The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow> object is in its normal (default) state.| |`DataControlRowState.Selected`|The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow> object is selected.|
This property is commonly used to determine the state of a row before performing an operation.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow.RowState%2A> property to determine whether a row is in edit mode or is selected. If the user selects a different row while the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control is in edit mode, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control exits edit mode.
[!code-aspx-csharp[GridViewRowRowState#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/GridViewRowRowState/CS/gridviewrowrowstatecs.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[GridViewRowRowState#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/GridViewRowRowState/VB/gridviewrowrowstatevb.aspx#1)]

Docs.summary: Gets the row type of the object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow.RowType%2A> property to determine the type of row that the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow> object represents. The following table lists the different row type values using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlRowType> enumeration.
|Row type|Description| |--------------|-----------------| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlRowType.DataRow>|A data row in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlRowType.Footer>|The footer row in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlRowType.Header>|The header row in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlRowType.EmptyDataRow>|The empty row in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control. The empty row is displayed when <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control does not have any records to display.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlRowType.Pager>|A pager row in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlRowType.Separator>|A separator row in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control.|
This property is commonly used to determine a row's type before performing an operation.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow.RowType%2A> property to determine whether a row being created is a footer row. If the row is a footer row, the value for the sum of the column is updated into the footer row.
[!code-aspx-csharp[GridViewRowRowType#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/GridViewRowRowType/CS/gridviewrowrowtypecs.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[GridViewRowRowType#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/GridViewRowRowType/VB/gridviewrowrowtypevb.aspx#1)]
